Modes¶

Vaillant operation modes.

Mode¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.Mode(name: str = None)¶

This is the base class for modes, it groups QuickVeto, OperatingMode, QuickMode and SettingMode.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the mode.

QuickVeto¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.QuickVeto(duration: Optional[int] = None, target: float = None)¶

Represents a quick veto which can be applied to a Zone or a Room.

For a Room, quick veto duration is customizable and it’s possible to get the remaining duration through the API. The max value is 1440 minutes (1 day)

For a Zone, quick veto duration is not customizable (default duration is 6 hours) and the API returns always 0.

Parameters

  • duration (int) – remaining duration in minutes before the quick veto expires. Since remaining duration is not available for a Zone, value will be None.

  • target (float) – target temperature defined by the quick veto.

OperatingMode¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode(name: str = None)¶

Represents the operating mode of a Component

OperatingModes¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingModes¶

Groups all OperatingMode together.

AUTO = OperatingMode(name='AUTO')¶

The automatic mode controls the heating circuit in accordance with the set desired temperature and the set time slots.

DAY = OperatingMode(name='DAY')¶

The Day operating mode brings the heating circuit to the desired Day temperature set, without taking time periods into account.

MANUAL = OperatingMode(name='MANUAL')¶

The manual operating mode is used by a Room to set manually the target temperature and keep it until next manual change.

NIGHT = OperatingMode(name='NIGHT')¶

The Set-back (Night) operating mode brings the heating circuit to the desired Set-back temperature set, without taking time periods into consideration.

OFF = OperatingMode(name='OFF')¶

The operating mode “Off” switches the corresponding function off. The frost protection function is activated.

ON = OperatingMode(name='ON')¶

The operating mode “On” applies to Hotwater and Circulation, it means the Component is running on.

QUICK_VETO = OperatingMode(name='QUICK_VETO')¶

The Quick veto function can be used to make one-off changes to the temperature. This function sets the desired target temperature, which may differ from that configured in the TimeProgram currently being used . The newly set temperature will be applied for a certain period of time.

classmethod get(name: str) → pymultimatic.model.mode.OperatingMode¶

Get OperatingMode by name.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of the operating mode

Returns

The corresponding operating mode or None

SettingMode¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.SettingMode(name: str = None)¶

This is the setting which is configured in TimePeriodSetting.

SettingModes¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.SettingModes¶

Groups all SettingMode together.

DAY = SettingMode(name='DAY')¶

Within the time periods, the controller brings the Zone temperature to the DAY temp. heating that has been set (Comfort mode).

NIGHT = SettingMode(name='NIGHT')¶

Outside of the time period, the controller brings the Zone temperature to the Set-back temp. heating (NIGHT) that has been set.

OFF = SettingMode(name='OFF')¶

Outside the time period, HotWater generation (and Circulation) is switched off.

ON = SettingMode(name='ON')¶

Within the time period, HotWater generation is switched on and maintains the hot water in the domestic hot water cylinder at the preset temperature. This also means the Circulation is switched off.

classmethod get(name: str) → pymultimatic.model.mode.SettingMode¶

Get SettingMode by name.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of the setting mode

Returns

The corresponding setting mode or None

QuickMode¶

class pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickMode(name: str = None, for_zone: bool = None, for_room: bool = None, for_dhw: bool = None)¶

This class is a helper to check what is impacted by a quick mode.

Quick modes are mode you can quickly set with the mobile app, most of the time, they have system wise impact. This is different from QuickVeto, which will only impact one Component.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the quick mode.

  • for_zone (bool) – quick mode is applicable for a Zone.

  • for_room (bool) – quick mode is applicable for a Room.

  • for_dhw (bool) – quick mode is applicable for a HotWater and Circulation.

Note

There is a default duration for quick modes (which can’t be changed) but the API always returns 0 as remaining duration, so there is no way to know when quick mode will end.

Vaillant documentation link about quick modes: http://elearning.vaillant.com/vrc700/ci/en/documents/uk/infopool/Operating_instructions.pdf

is_for(comp: pymultimatic.model.common.Component) → bool¶

Check if the quick mode has impact on the given component.

Parameters

comp (Component) – The component

Returns

Whether the component is affected by the quick mode or not.

Return type

bool

QuickModes¶

class pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickModes¶

Groups all QuickMode together.

HOLIDAY = QuickMode(name='QM_HOLIDAY', for_zone=True, for_room=True, for_dhw=True)¶
HOTWATER_BOOST = QuickMode(name='QM_HOTWATER_BOOST', for_zone=False, for_room=False, for_dhw=True)¶

The advanced function heats the water in the domestic hot water cylinder once until the desired DHW circuit temperature set is reached or until you cancel the advanced function early. The heating installation will then return to the pre-set mode

ONE_DAY_AT_HOME = QuickMode(name='QM_ONE_DAY_AT_HOME', for_zone=True, for_room=False, for_dhw=False)¶

This advanced function activates Automatic mode for one day with the settings for Sunday, as set using the Time programmes function. The advanced function is automatically deactivated after 24:00 hours or if you cancel the advanced function first. The heating installation will then return to the pre-set mode. The operating modes and time programme for Room are not affected.

ONE_DAY_AWAY = QuickMode(name='QM_ONE_DAY_AWAY', for_zone=True, for_room=False, for_dhw=True)¶

Hot water generation and circulation are switched off and the frost protection is activated. The advanced function is automatically deactivated after 24:00 hours or if you cancel the advanced function first. The heating installation will then return to the pre-set mode. Ventilation is activated and works at the lowest ventilation level.

PARTY = QuickMode(name='QM_PARTY', for_zone=True, for_room=False, for_dhw=False)¶

The advanced function brings the room temperature to the set desired Day temperature, in accordance with the set time periods. The advanced function is deactivated after six hours or if you cancel it before the six hours is up. The heating installation will then return to the pre-set mode.

QUICK_VETO = QuickMode(name='QM_QUICK_VETO', for_zone=False, for_room=False, for_dhw=False)¶

This advanced function activates a quick veto for one specific zone

SYSTEM_OFF = QuickMode(name='QM_SYSTEM_OFF', for_zone=True, for_room=True, for_dhw=True)¶

The heating function, hot water circuit and cooling are switched off. The frost protection function is activated. The circulation is switched off. Ventilation is activated and works at the lowest ventilation level.

VENTILATION_BOOST = QuickMode(name='QM_VENTILATION_BOOST', for_zone=True, for_room=False, for_dhw=False)¶

This advanced function switches the zone off for 30 minutes. The frost protection function is activated, and hot water generation and circulation remain active. Ventilation is activated and works at the highest ventilation level. The advanced function is automatically deactivated after 30 minutes or if you cancel the advanced function early. The heating installation will then return to the pre-set mode.

classmethod for_dhw() → List[pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickMode]¶

Get the list of QuickMode applicable to HotWater and Circulation.

Returns

A list of quick mode applicable for HotWater and Circulation.

classmethod for_room() → List[pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickMode]¶

Get the list of QuickMode applicable to Room.

Returns

A list of quick mode applicable for Room.

classmethod for_zone() → List[pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickMode]¶

Get the list of QuickMode applicable to Zone.

Returns

A list of quick mode applicable for Zone.

classmethod get(name: str) → pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.QuickMode¶

Get QuickMode by name.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of the operating mode

Returns

The corresponding operating mode or None

ActiveMode¶

class pymultimatic.model.mode.ActiveMode(target: Optional[float], current: pymultimatic.model.mode.Mode, sub: Optional[pymultimatic.model.mode.Mode] = None)¶

Active mode will let you know the real target temperature and the real Mode applied to a Component.

Note

This is based on the interpretation of the data coming from the API.

It can be quite complex to know what is going on from a Component, the API returns data at different places like for example:

  • the OperatingMode (and the QuickVeto) for a Component are found at one place

  • the system wise QuickMode is found somewhere else

  • not all the QuickMode are applicable to all Component

So, if a Zone is configured with OperatingModes.AUTO mode and there is a QuickModes.QM_SYSTEM_OFF active, the API won’t tell you what is the real mode applied to that Zone . In this case, the QuickModes.QM_SYSTEM_OFF will actually take precedence and it will have impact on the target temperature.

Parameters

  • target (Optional[float]) – Target temperature the Component tries to reach. Please note, there will be no target_temperature for Circulation.

  • current (Mode) – This is the mode that will be applied by your installation.

  • sub – (Mode): If mode is OperatingModes.AUTO, then sub_mode will be populated with the actual configured mode, coming from mode , otherwise it will be None

HolidayMode¶

class pymultimatic.model.quick_mode.HolidayMode(is_active: bool, start_date: Optional[datetime.date] = None, end_date: Optional[datetime.date] = None, target: Optional[float] = None)¶

Represents system’s holiday mode.

Parameters

  • is_active (bool) – Indicates whether the user has activated the holiday mode or not.

  • start_date (date) – Start date of the holiday mode.

  • end_date (date) – End date of the holiday mode.

  • target_temperature (float) – Target temperature when the holiday mode is applied.

Note

is_active doesn’t necessarily means the holiday mode is_applied: the user can activate the holiday mode through the mobile app but with end_date and start_date in the future.

property active_mode¶

Get the ActiveMode from holiday mode, if is_applied.

Type

Optional[ActiveMode]

property is_applied¶

Check if holiday mode is active and if today are between end_date and start_date.

Note

Use this to know if the holiday mode is active and applied to the system.

Type

bool
